samples.context: All of these changes are aspects of the sexual maturation of the body. Why does the body show sexual maturation at this age? We have talked about the need for specialised cell types in multi-cellular bodies to carry out specialised functions.
samples.question: What is sexual maturation?

samples.context: Puberty: This period during adolescence is called puberty. So how do all the changes that we have talked about link to the reproductive process?
samples.question: What is puberty defined as?

samples.context: Human beings also develop special tissues for this purpose. Puberty: This period during adolescence is called puberty.
samples.question: What develops during human sexual maturation?

samples.context: This can happen by the external release of germ-cells from the bodies of individuals, as happens in flowering plants. Or it can happen by two individuals joining their bodies together.
samples.question: How can germ-cells be transferred in reproduction?

samples.context: We have seen that plants develop special cell and tissue types to create them. Human beings also develop special tissues for this purpose.
samples.question: What do humans develop for sexual reproduction?

samples.context: So how do all the changes that we have talked about link to the reproductive process? This can happen by the external release of germ-cells from the bodies of individuals.
samples.question: What happens during the reproductive process?
